text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to mention Article 31 of the Vienna Convention on the Law of Treaties (VCLT) as relevant to reading silence on counterclaims. The candidate answer discusses the silence in the treaty in the context of consent (Section I.A.1) and notes that UNCITRAL Rules Art. 21(3) permits counterclaims but does not cure the lack of consent in the underlying treaty.
